image.altText: An empty Westfield Marion.

props.synopsis: As police arrest a third teenager over an alleged fight which locked down Westfield Marion shopping centre on Sunday, an Adelaide court is told another of the accused "never intended" for the altercation to cause the level of fear that it did, and is currently struggling with homelessness.

title.children: Third arrest over alleged fight which triggered shopping centre lockdown as court hears of co-accused's homelessness

image.altText: Two cctv photos of a man holding a gun inside banks.

props.synopsis: South Australia's notorious "bicycle bandit" has been handed a 35-year sentence for a series of armed bank robberies, but will serve very little time in prison.

title.children: Terminally-ill 'bicycle bandit' handed 35-year sentence, but court told his death is imminent

image.altText: A sign at the Marion Shopping Centre.

props.synopsis: SA Police say they had rehearsed an armed offender situation with Westfield Marion officials just days before a fight broke out in the food court of South Australia's largest shopping centre, sending it into lockdown.

title.children: Westfield Marion fight puts police response to the test for the first time since Bondi Junction stabbing attack

image.altText: roofs of houses, most of them with solar panels

props.synopsis: The Coalition wants nuclear to be the Yin to rooftop solar's Yang. But some experts say the technologies make terrible bedfellows.

title.children: Behind the grand plans for nuclear is a potentially fatal flaw. And it's on millions of roofs

image.altText: someone vaping

props.synopsis: Australia will become the first country to ban the sale of vapes outside of pharmacies after the Greens agreed to a major deal to pass the world-first legislation. Follow live.

title.children: Over 18s will still be able to buy vapes from pharmacies as govt strikes deal with Greens

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Costco likely to be captured by mandatory code but Amazon off the hook, for now
Labor grilled over $200k pay increase for G-G
Breaking: World-first vaping ban to become law

image.altText: a man standing at a podium with his hand up against his ear pretending to speak into a phone

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party's most recognisable climate campaigner has been tapped by Labor to assume Australia's top climate advisory role.

title.children: Liberal Matt Kean, long a thorn in his own party's side, has been offered a job by Labor

image.altText: A man in a hoodie and a black baseball cap

props.synopsis: Shoppers and retail workers detail the terrifying moments they found themselves sprinting and screaming through Westfield Marion shopping centre in suburban Adelaide on a Sunday afternoon.

title.children: Eyewitnesses recount panic and confusion inside Westfield Marion after lockdown

props.synopsis: When Rob Rankine saw the local nursing home sitting empty, he decided to do something about it. Now 18 people, including employee Mia Harris, have a place to call home.

title.children: 'There's just nowhere around': Publican turns empty aged care facility into long-term accommodation amid a housing crisis

image.altText: a man standing holding a first aid guide

props.synopsis: A paedophile water polo coach convicted of grooming a child for sex in Australia has been deported from the UK after the ABC found him working as a children's lifeguard at a family water park.

title.children: Paedophile deported from UK after ABC investigation found him working as children's lifeguard

image.altText: Close up of shopping trolley in supermarket aisle

props.synopsis: Consumers might not feel the effects of a mandatory grocery conduct overhaul, a peak consumer policy body says.

title.children: The grocery code of conduct overhaul could mean good things for suppliers. What about Aussies at the check-out?

image.altText: Two women sit on an unfinished deck outside a converted shed. They are looking at the camera with neutral expression.

props.synopsis: The mystery of what went wrong at one of Australia's biggest fertility clinics haunts this couple.

title.children: 'We got the wrong sperm': Anastasia and Lexie are living an IVF nightmare. The clinic won't take responsibility

image.altText: A composite image of Cara Delevingne, Sabrina Carpenter and Ivy Getty.

props.synopsis: The third iteration of Vogue World has set up camp in the French capital ahead of next month's Olympics, putting on a parade in the city's Place Vendôme.

title.children: All the looks from Vogue World: Paris as Serena Williams and Sabrina Carpenter make surprise runway cameos

image.altText: Police tape blocks off a crime scene in Mackay.

props.synopsis: Police say they have recovered a 22-calibre pistol believed to have been used in the alleged murder of a Mackay mother outside her home last week.

title.children: Police recover pistol believed to have been used in alleged murder of Mackay mother

image.altText: Tayla Williams smiles in her Adelaide Thunderbirds pink dress

props.synopsis: A million Australian women and girls suffer from endometriosis at some point in their life — the same number of participants in netball. That's why premiership player Tayla Williams is using her platform to break taboos about period talk.

title.children: One in a million: Netballer sparks important conversation about endometriosis

image.altText: A woman in a green bikini lies on the concrete bank of the Seine river reading, with a view of Paris visible in the background

props.synopsis: The US Olympic team will use temporary air conditioning units at the Paris athletes' village, as concerns grow over the impact of heat on competitors.

title.children: US athletes to get aircon in Paris amid heat fears for Olympians

image.altText: A white man wearing an apron stands in the doorway of a cafe with large plants and wooden furniture.

props.synopsis: Gentrification continues to expand further away from the centre of major cities. There are several indicators that can give you a hint your suburb is heading for a transformation.

title.children: There goes the neighbourhood. How to tell if your area is next in the gentrification firing line

image.altText: Smoke rising from a building

props.synopsis: An Orthodox Church priest and police officers are dead after the "terrorist" attacks, according to Russia's National Anti-Terrorism Committee.

title.children: More than 15 dead after gunmen open fire on Russian churches and synagogue

image.altText: A yacht sits offshore of a burning forest, at night.

props.synopsis: Greek authorities arrest 13 yacht crew members and passengers after a forest fire allegedly sparked by fireworks launched from the boat.

title.children: Greece arrests 13 after yacht fireworks spark pine forest blaze

image.altText: Myer in The Myer Centre in Brisbane CBD, people walking past

props.synopsis: Wall Street's weak lead flows through to the ASX while in retail news, Myer and Premier Investments are mulling over a big deal and the federal government has unveiled its mandatory Food and Grocery Code of Conduct that aims to protect suppliers from supermarkets' buying power. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX down 0.7 per cent, Myer and Premier Investments plot a big deal and supermarket reforms unveiled

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Are we facing a wind drought and what does it mean for the grid?
Myer and Premier Investments look at a big deal — shares of both soar

image.altText: A hand with painted nails drops a ballot paper into a plastic box and Blinky Bill with three eyes

props.synopsis: While many in the political debate are focused on Mr Burns, the hapless Homer and three-eyed fish, I'm wondering what Lisa Simpson would make of the nuclear debate. And judging by data on gender from the last election, both major parties may want to consider this too.

title.children: Meme wars around the nuclear debate are masking a real problem: the gender dynamics of elections are shifting

image.altText: A white van carrying Armaguard's badge logo stationary in a parking lot.

props.synopsis: Armaguard's biggest customers will pour up to $50 million into the troubled cash transporter to keep it afloat for the next 12 months.

title.children: Cash crisis averted by $50 million bailout to keep Armaguard afloat

image.altText: People hold photographs and behind man sitting in hearing.

props.synopsis: The US Justice Department is deciding whether to prosecute Boeing after finding the plane manufacturer violated a settlement related to two fatal crashes.

title.children: US prosecutors recommend DOJ criminally charge Boeing

image.altText: Craig Townsend 2024-06-21 08:06:00

props.synopsis: If you want to get a sense of the "insane" nature of Perth's property market right now and the breakneck speed at which homes are selling, look no further than Craig Townsend's experiences last week.

title.children: How 'crazy' is Perth's housing market? Ask Craig Townsend, who just lost out on a home literally at the last minute

image.altText: Aaron Karl Labrook leaving court.

props.synopsis: A Rebels bikie gang leader who claimed his murdered predecessor was spending club funds on home renovations is found guilty of possessing more than $450,000 in cash suspected of being unlawfully obtained.

title.children: Boss of bikie gang in 'disarray' found guilty of possessing more than $450,000 in unlawful cash

image.altText: Amy Yang, in red shirt and white bucket hat, has champagne poured on her by other golfers after winning the PGA Championship.

props.synopsis: The top two Australians at the Women's PGA Championship finish in a tie for 24th, but honorary Australian Amy Yang takes the win after a series of near misses.

title.children: Former Gold Coast high school prodigy wins Women's PGA Championship

image.altText: A top AFL executive sits at a desk facing the media with microphones in front of him.

props.synopsis: Andrew Wilkie says the AFL "dodged a WADA breach on a technicality" as Sport Integrity Australia finds there is no evidence to support the MP's explosive claims.

title.children: 'Dodged a breach on a technicality': MP stands by accusations despite SIA clearing AFL of illicit drug claims

image.altText: Arisa Trew

props.synopsis: Tokyo gold medal winner Keegan Palmer and 14-year-old Arisa Trew both claim gold for Australia at the Olympic Qualifier Series in Budapest.

title.children: Teen sensation and Tokyo gold medal winner claim victories in Olympic qualifiers in Budapest

image.altText: Two white Arctic wolves stand on snowy ground with one in the foreground looking back directly at the camera

props.synopsis: Investigators are looking into how a female jogger ended up in a wolf enclosure at a safari-style zoo outside Paris.

title.children: Woman attacked by wolves after straying into zoo 'safari zone'

image.altText: Cars with broken windows.

props.synopsis: As Russia's aerial bombardment of Kharkiv in north-east Ukraine continues, Russian authorities say falling debris from Ukrainian missiles has killed people in the annexed territory of Crimea.

title.children: Six killed in Ukrainian drone and missile attacks on Russia and Crimea

image.altText: Drone shot of a boat parked up on a tropical island

props.synopsis: The Woppaburra people are hoping to claim nine square kilometres of land on Great Keppel Island including an air strip and the abandoned "party paradise" Mercure resort.

title.children: Government to challenge Aboriginal group's exclusive use claim of Great Barrier Reef island land

image.altText: A split image shows Keir Starmer, Nigel Farage and Rishi Sunak all in suits and ties

props.synopsis: With even the conservative bastions of British media predicting a bruising defeat for the Tories at next week's UK election, perhaps this is a sign Britons grappling with the cost of living would prefer bland stability over charisma.

title.children: The UK election is Labour's to lose — and in the meantime, Nigel Farage is coming for the Tories' votes

image.altText: Two adults and a child holding a sign on the side of a road, near street signs.

props.synopsis: A few weeks ago, the Jones family was waking to icy cold winter mornings. Now, they're seeing how far their thumbs can take them on the journey from central Victoria to India.

title.children: Meet the 'time-rich, cash-poor' Australian family hitchhiking their way to India on the adventure of a lifetime

image.altText: A woman wearing a beanie, puffer jacket, scarf and gloves sits in her car, unable to move as the windscreen is frozen.

props.synopsis: Readers recommend using cardboard and towels to prevent ice from forming, plus a handful of inexpensive tools to deal with an icy windscreen at the start of the day.

title.children: Squeezy water bottles, cardboard and potatoes: How you deal with icy windscreens in winter
